channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Addressing detection of left bundle branch block by means of electrocardiogram’s signals using Machine Learning algorithms
item.description: LBBB is a cardiovascular disease that affects the heart’s electrical conduction system and may indicate the presence of underlying diseases.

item.title: Beyond Myopia: Learning from Positive and Unlabeled Data through Holistic Predictive Trends
item.description: Learning binary classifiers from positive and unlabeled data (PUL) is vital in many real-world applications, especially when verifying negative examples is difficult.

item.title: Self-Supervised Neuron Segmentation with Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: By extracting semantic information from unlabeled data, self-supervised methods can improve the performance of downstream tasks, among which the mask image model (MIM) has been widely used due to its simplicity and effectiveness in recovering original information from masked images.

item.title: Language Agent Tree Search Unifies Reasoning Acting and Planning in Language Models
item.description: While large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive performance on a range of decision-making tasks, they rely on simple acting processes and fall short of broad deployment as autonomous agents.

item.title: Latent Graph Inference with Limited Supervision
item.description: We begin by defining the pivotal nodes as $k$-hop starved nodes, which can be identified based on a given adjacency matrix.

item.title: Understanding, Predicting and Better Resolving Q-Value Divergence in Offline-RL
item.description: We first identify a fundamental pattern, self-excitation, as the primary cause of Q-value estimation divergence in offline RL.

item.title: Saliency-Guided Hidden Associative Replay for Continual Learning
item.description: Continual Learning is a burgeoning domain in next-generation AI, focusing on training neural networks over a sequence of tasks akin to human learning.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning with Fast and Forgetful Memory
item.description: Nearly all real world tasks are inherently partially observable, necessitating the use of memory in Reinforcement Learning (RL).

item.title: Automatic Aspect Extraction from Scientific Texts
item.description: Being able to extract from scientific papers their main points, key insights, and other important information, referred to here as aspects, might facilitate the process of conducting a scientific literature review.

item.title: Asymptotically free sketched ridge ensembles: Risks, cross-validation, and tuning
item.description: We also propose an "ensemble trick" whereby the risk for unsketched ridge regression can be efficiently estimated via GCV using small sketched ridge ensembles.

item.title: Dementia Assessment Using Mandarin Speech with an Attention-based Speech Recognition Encoder
item.description: Subsequently, we extracted the encoder from the speech recognition model and added a linear layer for dementia assessment.

item.title: FedConv: Enhancing Convolutional Neural Networks for Handling Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is an emerging paradigm in machine learning, where a shared model is collaboratively learned using data from multiple devices to mitigate the risk of data leakage.

item.title: Degradation-Aware Self-Attention Based Transformer for Blind Image Super-Resolution
item.description: In particular, we integrate both CNN and Transformer components into the SR network, where we first use the CNN modulated by the degradation information to extract local features, and then employ the degradation-aware Transformer to extract global semantic features.

item.title: Why Do We Need Weight Decay in Modern Deep Learning?
item.description: In this work, we highlight that the role of weight decay in modern deep learning is different from its regularization effect studied in classical learning theory.

item.title: Enhancing Financial Sentiment Analysis via Retrieval Augmented Large Language Models
item.description: Financial sentiment analysis is critical for valuation and investment decision-making.

item.title: Introducing the Attribution Stability Indicator: a Measure for Time Series XAI Attributions
item.description: Given the increasing amount and general complexity of time series data in domains such as finance, weather forecasting, and healthcare, there is a growing need for state-of-the-art performance models that can provide interpretable insights into underlying patterns and relationships.

item.title: Towards Foundational Models for Molecular Learning on Large-Scale Multi-Task Datasets
item.description: Recently, pre-trained foundation models have enabled significant advancements in multiple fields.

item.title: Whole Slide Multiple Instance Learning for Predicting Axillary Lymph Node Metastasis
item.description: Breast cancer is a major concern for women's health globally, with axillary lymph node (ALN) metastasis identification being critical for prognosis evaluation and treatment guidance.

item.title: Aorta Segmentation from 3D CT in MICCAI SEG.A. 2023 Challenge
item.description: In this work, we describe our solution to the Segmentation of the Aorta (SEG. A. 231) from 3D CT challenge.

item.title: Automated 3D Segmentation of Kidneys and Tumors in MICCAI KiTS 2023 Challenge
item.description: Kidney and Kidney Tumor Segmentation Challenge (KiTS) 2023 offers a platform for researchers to compare their solutions to segmentation from 3D CT.

item.title: In the Blink of an Eye: Event-based Emotion Recognition
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, our method is the first eye-based emotion recognition method that leverages event-based cameras and spiking neural network.

item.title: Joint Projection Learning and Tensor Decomposition Based Incomplete Multi-view Clustering
item.description: We further consider the graph noise of projected data caused by missing samples and use a tensor-decomposition based graph filter for robust clustering. JPLTD decomposes the original tensor into an intrinsic tensor and a sparse tensor.

item.title: TiC: Exploring Vision Transformer in Convolution
item.description: While models derived from Vision Transformers (ViTs) have been phonemically surging, pre-trained models cannot seamlessly adapt to arbitrary resolution images without altering the architecture and configuration, such as sampling the positional encoding, limiting their flexibility for various vision tasks.

item.title: Collaborative Camouflaged Object Detection: A Large-Scale Dataset and Benchmark
item.description: In this paper, we provide a comprehensive study on a new task called collaborative camouflaged object detection (CoCOD), which aims to simultaneously detect camouflaged objects with the same properties from a group of relevant images.

item.title: Hermes: Unlocking Security Analysis of Cellular Network Protocols by Synthesizing Finite State Machines from Natural Language Specifications
item.description: In this paper, we present Hermes, an end-to-end framework to automatically generate formal representations from natural language cellular specifications.

item.title: Latent Consistency Models: Synthesizing High-Resolution Images with Few-Step Inference
item.description: Inspired by Consistency Models (song et al.), we propose Latent Consistency Models (LCMs), enabling swift inference with minimal steps on any pre-trained LDMs, including Stable Diffusion (rombach et al).

item.title: Bivariate Estimation-of-Distribution Algorithms Can Find an Exponential Number of Optima
item.description: We show that the bivariate EDA mutual-information-maximizing input clustering, without any problem-specific modification, quickly generates a model that behaves very similarly to a theoretically ideal model for EBOM, which samples each of the exponentially many optima with the same maximal probability.

item.title: Can pre-trained models assist in dataset distillation?
item.description: Dataset Distillation (DD) is a prominent technique that encapsulates knowledge from a large-scale original dataset into a small synthetic dataset for efficient training.

item.title: Robust Zero Level-Set Extraction from Unsigned Distance Fields Based on Double Covering
item.description: We show that the computed iso-surface is the boundary of the $r$-offset volume of the target zero level-set $S$, which is an orientable manifold, regardless of the topology of $S$.

item.title: High-dimensional Bayesian Optimization with Group Testing
item.description: We propose a group testing approach to identify active variables to facilitate efficient optimization in these domains.

item.title: CSI: Enhancing the Robustness of 3D Point Cloud Recognition against Corruption
item.description: In this study, we harness the inherent set property of point cloud data to introduce a novel critical subset identification (CSI) method, aiming to bolster recognition robustness in the face of data corruption.

item.title: Plug-and-Play Posterior Sampling under Mismatched Measurement and Prior Models
item.description: Posterior sampling has been shown to be a powerful Bayesian approach for solving imaging inverse problems.

item.title: FNOSeg3D: Resolution-Robust 3D Image Segmentation with Fourier Neural Operator
item.description: Due to the computational complexity of 3D medical image segmentation, training with downsampled images is a common remedy for out-of-memory errors in deep learning.

item.title: FreeReg: Image-to-Point Cloud Registration Leveraging Pretrained Diffusion Models and Monocular Depth Estimators
item.description: Matching cross-modality features between images and point clouds is a fundamental problem for image-to-point cloud registration.

item.title: Functional data learning using convolutional neural networks
item.description: In this paper, we show how convolutional neural networks (CNN) can be used in regression and classification learning problems of noisy and non-noisy functional data.

item.title: LESSON: Learning to Integrate Exploration Strategies for Reinforcement Learning via an Option Framework
item.description: In this paper, a unified framework for exploration in reinforcement learning (RL) is proposed based on an option-critic model.

item.title: Analysis of learning a flow-based generative model from limited sample complexity
item.description: We study the problem of training a flow-based generative model, parametrized by a two-layer autoencoder, to sample from a high-dimensional Gaussian mixture.

item.title: A Long Way to Go: Investigating Length Correlations in RLHF
item.description: Furthermore, we find that even running RLHF with a reward based solely on length can reproduce most of the downstream improvements over the initial policy model, showing that reward models in these settings have a long way to go.

item.title: Contextualized Structural Self-supervised Learning for Ontology Matching
item.description: Ontology matching (OM) entails the identification of semantic relationships between concepts within two or more knowledge graphs (KGs) and serves as a critical step in integrating KGs from various sources.

item.title: FreshLLMs: Refreshing Large Language Models with Search Engine Augmentation
item.description: Specifically, we introduce FreshQA, a novel dynamic QA benchmark encompassing a diverse range of question and answer types, including questions that require fast-changing world knowledge as well as questions with false premises that need to be debunked.

item.title: Provable benefits of annealing for estimating normalizing constants: Importance Sampling, Noise-Contrastive Estimation, and beyond
item.description: Second, we find that using the geometric path brings down the estimation error from an exponential to a polynomial function of the parameter distance between the target and proposal distributions.

item.title: Certifiably Robust Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Extensive experiments on real-world datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method in providing effective certifiable robustness and enhancing the robustness of any GCL model.

item.title: Kandinsky: an Improved Text-to-Image Synthesis with Image Prior and Latent Diffusion
item.description: Text-to-image generation is a significant domain in modern computer vision and has achieved substantial improvements through the evolution of generative architectures.

item.title: Aligning Text-to-Image Diffusion Models with Reward Backpropagation
item.description: Due to their unsupervised training, controlling their behavior in downstream tasks, such as maximizing human-perceived image quality, image-text alignment, or ethical image generation, is difficult.

item.title: Agent Instructs Large Language Models to be General Zero-Shot Reasoners
item.description: For instance, our method boosts the performance of state-of-the-art large language models by a large margin, including Vicuna-13b (13. 3%), Llama-2-70b-chat (23. 2%), and GPT-3. 5 Turbo (17. 0%).

item.title: Unbiased estimation of sampling variance for Simpson's diversity index
item.description: Quantification of measurement uncertainty is a cornerstone of scientific inquiry.

item.title: Point-Based Radiance Fields for Controllable Human Motion Synthesis
item.description: This paper proposes a novel controllable human motion synthesis method for fine-level deformation based on static point-based radiance fields.

item.title: RL-based Stateful Neural Adaptive Sampling and Denoising for Real-Time Path Tracing
item.description: Monte-Carlo path tracing is a powerful technique for realistic image synthesis but suffers from high levels of noise at low sample counts, limiting its use in real-time applications.

item.title: Characterizing the Features of Mitotic Figures Using a Conditional Diffusion Probabilistic Model
item.description: In this paper, our goal is to shed light on the inherent uncertainty of mitosis labels and characterize the mitotic figure classification task in a human interpretable manner.

item.title: MathCoder: Seamless Code Integration in LLMs for Enhanced Mathematical Reasoning
item.description: In this paper, we present a method to fine-tune open-source language models, enabling them to use code for modeling and deriving math equations and, consequently, enhancing their mathematical reasoning abilities.
